definitions.definition: to (cause to) lean in a position that is not vertical; to (cause to) slope:
examples: Italic writing slants to the right.

definitions.definition: to present information in a particular way, especially showing one group of people, one side of an argument, etc. in such a positive or negative way that it is unfair:
examples: The police claimed that reports in the media were slanted against/towards the defendant.

definitions.definition: a position or direction that is sloping:
examples: The car was parked on a slant.

definitions.definition: a particular way of showing or looking at something:
examples: The book had a personal/political/sociological slant.
